thread.title: Capital Region Academic R&D Spending Rose 5.4% in 2016
thread.title_full: Capital Region Academic R&D Spending Rose 5.4% in 2016

posts.author: Megan Rooney
posts.title: Capital Region Academic R&D Spending Rose 5.4% in 2016
posts.text:
Capital Region Academic R&D Spending Rose 5.4% in FY2016 Region is the Northeast’s 8 th Biggest and 6 th Most Intense Spender on University Innovation 

Academic research and development expenditures at Albany-Schenectady-Troy metropolitan statistical area (MSA) higher education institutions increased over the year by more than $28 million, or 5.4 percent. In fiscal 2016, eight local colleges and universities spent a total $562.4 million on R&D, with more than four-fifths of that amount going toward life science and engineering innovation, according to a Center for Economic Growth analysis of National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics (NCSES) data . 
Metro Area Performance 
In fiscal 2016, three institutions – SUNY Polytechnic Institute, University at Albany (UAlbany) and Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI) – each spent more than $100 million on R&D. Driving up the Albany-Schenectady-Troy MSA’s academic spending was R&D in environmental sciences, which was up 69.5 percent to $20.7 million, and engineering, which was up 3.8 percent to $374.4 million. A 760.5 percent increase in non-science and engineering R&D spending to $22.2 million, largely at UAlbany, also boosted the metro area’s fiscal 2016 expenditures total. Non-science and engineering R&D includes subfields such as business, education, communication and social work. Environmental sciences include geosciences, atmospheric sciences and ocean sciences. 
At $312.2 million, SUNY Poly was the region’s biggest spender on engineering. That also made SUNY Poly the nation’s fourth biggest engineering R&D spender, trailing only John Hopkins University, Georgia Institute of Technology and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. SUNY Poly’s engineering R&D ranking moved up from sixth in fiscal 2015. UAlbany last fiscal year spent $17.1 million in atmospheric science R&D, up from $9.4 million in fiscal 2015. That 82.3 percent increase sent UAlbany’s ranking in this field to 47 from 77. 
Regionwide, that R&D spending supported 656 principal investigators and 3,324 other personnel, totaling 3,962. Total personnel, not including nearly 180 postdocs, was up 8.5 percent from fiscal 2015. RPI experienced the metro area’s greatest annual increase in total personnel: 469 additional personnel, or up 33.1 percent, to 1,884. RPI employs nearly half (47.6 percent) of the metro area’s academic R&D personnel. Northeast MSA Performance 
Among the 32 Northeastern MSAs with colleges and universities for which NCSES reported R&D expenditures, the Albany-Schenectady-Troy MSA had the eighth highest total academic R&D expenditures, right behind the State College/Harrisburg-Carlisle* and before the Providence-Warwick MSAs. At $4 billion, the New York-Newark-Jersey City MSA was the Northeast’s top academic R&D spender. However, when taking into account the size of each metro area’s economy, as measured by their gross metropolitan product (GMP), it becomes apparent that large metros are not spending on R&D as intensely as their smaller counterparts. This metric is referred to as “R&D intensity.”** 
For example, the New York-Newark-Jersey City MSA’s fiscal 2016 R&D intensity was $2.44, the 19 th highest in the Northeast. In contrast, the Albany-Schenectady-Troy MSA had the Northeast’s sixth highest R&D intensity at $10.75. The Ithaca MSA had the Northeast’s highest R&D intensity at $191.02. 
CEG Industry Attraction 
The Capital Region’s R&D infrastructure is one of its most powerful draws to companies in the semiconductor, life sciences and cleantech industries. CEG and its Business Growth Solutions (BGS) unit leverage these R&D assets to do the following: 
Promote the region around the world at industry conferences. Upcoming events at which CEG staff will represent the region include the Industry Strategy Symposium (ISS), the BIO CEO & Investor Conference , the Select USA Canadian International Auto Show , the NY-BEST Annual Meeting and Conference and the Site Selector Guild’s Annual Conference . 
Improve startups’ access to labs at facilities, such as those at SUNY Poly and Albany Medical College’s Biomedical Acceleration and Commercialization Center (BACC); 
Accelerate commercialization by leveraging tech scouting, gathering technology-driven market intelligence, engaging Empire State Development’s Division of Science, Technology and Innovation ( NYSTAR ) for testing and development; 
Develop prototypes with a Stratasys F270 3D printer or providing hand-on access to it; 
Assist in the preparation of grant applications for the National Institutes of Health (NIH), Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) program and Small Business Technology Transfer Program; and 
Identify potential investors and providing venture pitch coaching through the VentureB series. 
Notes 
* The State College MSA includes the Harrisburg-Carlisle MSA because R&D expenditure data for Pennsylvania State University, University Park in the former and Hershey Medical Center in the latter are jointly reported to NCSES. 
** R&D intensity = R&D expenditures per $1,000 GMP 

Don’t miss these insights into the trends that are shaping the Capital Region’s economy. Sign up for CEG’s e-news and follow us on:

thread.title: ‘Big Brother’ Stars Victor Arroyo, Natalie Negrotti Join MTV’s ‘The Challenge: Vendettas’
thread.title_full: ‘Big Brother’ Stars Victor Arroyo, Natalie Negrotti Join MTV’s ‘The Challenge: Vendettas’

posts.author: Camille Heimbrod
posts.title: ‘Big Brother’ Stars Victor Arroyo, Natalie Negrotti Join MTV’s ‘The Challenge: Vendettas’
posts.text:
“Big Brother” Season 18 alums Victor Arroyo and Natalie Negrotti will be starring in the 31st season of MTV’s “The Challenge: Vendettas.”
The two former houseguests will be traveling to Spain to pursue their personal vendettas against each other, as well as the other contestants. For the first time in the reality TV show’s history, the contestants will be working by themselves and not as members of their teams.
Only one winner could bring home the $500,000 grand prize in the end. And this figure might increase depending on the results of the competition. There will be challenges in every episode, and whoever wins will receive money for their individual bank accounts. The money of the contestants who are eliminated will be added to the final prize pot.
The objective of “ The Challenge: Vendettas ” is simple: to make sure that you will win or that the people you dislike won’t. In the teaser released by MTV, the cast of the reality TV show are screaming and pushing each other. Some contestants also seem to be falling in love and others are also hooking up.
Meanwhile, the 28 contestants in “The Challenge: Vendettas” previously starred in other shows, such as, MTV UK’s “Ex On the Beach” and “Geordie Shore.” “The Challenge: Cutthroat” winner, Brad Fiorenza, will also be returning to the competition this year.
“Are You The One?” alum Devin Walker is also one of the contestants this season. Devin admits that he’s not the strongest or fastest player in the house. However, he knows he can easily manipulate people.
Victor was dubbed as America’s Favorite Player during the 18 th season of CBS’ “Big Brother.” The former houseguest is used to getting his hands dirty in order to win.
He previously expressed an interest in Natalie, a former NFL cheerleader. The event coordinator fell in love with Texas native James Huling instead. It’s possible that the two could revisit their budding romance in “The Challenge: Vendettas.” But it’s important to note that Arroyo is dating Nicole Franzel at the moment. 
Other contestants include “Are You The One?” alum Kam Williams, “Dirty 30” star Veronica Portillo, “Road Rules” veteran Shan Lundrum and more.
“The Challenge: Vendettas” will premiere on MTV on Jan. 2.

Natalie Negrotti and Victor Arroyo of “Big Brother” Season 18 will head to MTV’s “The Challenge: Vendettas” starting Jan. 2. Photo: CBS

thread.section_title: METRO NEWS | NEWS
thread.title: California wind, and fire danger, hits unprecedented high
thread.title_full: California wind, and fire danger, hits unprecedented high

posts.author: Amanda Lee Myers And Andrew Dalton - The Associated Press
posts.title: California wind, and fire danger, hits unprecedented high
posts.text: California wind, and fire danger, hits unprecedented high Share on Facebook Share via Email Print Workers from the Los Angeles Dept. of Water and Power walk past a home destroyed by wildfire along Via San Anselmo in the Sylmar area of Los Angeles Wednesday, Dec. 6, 2017. (AP Photo/Chris Carlson) By: Amanda Lee Myers And Andrew Dalton The Associated Press Published on VENTURA, Calif. — Southern California has felt yellow wind, orange wind, and red wind. But never purple wind. Until now. The colour -coded system showing the expected strength of the winds driving the region's fierce wildfires has reached uncharted territory, pushing past red, which means "high" into the colour that means "extreme." "The forecast for tomorrow is purple," said Ken Pimlott, director at the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection. "We've never used purple before." Southern California has already been hit hard by three major fires that have put tens of thousands of people under evacuation orders and destroyed at nearly 200 homes and buildings, a figure that is almost certain to grow. But the hard-won progress of firefighters could be erased Thursday. "We're talking winds that can surface that can be 80 miles an hour," Pimlott said. "These will be winds that there will no ability to fight fires." Such winds can instantly turn a tiny fire into a large one, or carry embers that spark new fires miles away. Millions of cellphones buzzed loudly Tuesday night from San Diego to Santa Barbara with a sound that usually means an Amber Alert, but this time meant a rare weather warning for strong winds making extreme fire danger. Officials hope the electronic push will keep the whole region alert and keep the death toll from the week's fires at zero. Melissa Rosenzweig, 47, was briefly back home Tuesday after evacuating from her Ventura house, which has been spared so far while most on her street had burned in the largest and most destructive of the region's fires. She and her husband were about to evacuate again, hoping they will get lucky twice as the new winds arrive. "Heck yeah I'm still worried," Rosenzweig said. "We're very grateful but I know we're not out of the woods." In what may have been an early sign of the 140-square-mile fire getting new life, several thousand new evacuations were ordered late Tuesday night in Ojai, a town of artists and resorts. The blaze had been creeping there already, but an increase in winds pushed it close enough for many more to flee. The wilder winds could easily send make new fires explode too, as one did Wednesday in Los Angeles' exclusive Bel-Air section, where a fire consumed multimillion-dollar houses that give the rich and famous sweeping views of Los Angeles. Little flame was visible by late Tuesday, but in the morning fire exploded on the steep slopes of Sepulveda Pass, closing a section of heavily travelled Interstate 405 and destroying four homes. Flames burned a wine storage shed at media mogul Rupert Murdoch's 16-acre (6.5-hectare) Moraga Vineyards estate and appeared to have damaged about 7 acres (2.8 hectares) of vines, a spokeswoman said. Across the wide I-405 freeway from the fire, the Getty Center art complex was closed to protect its collection from smoke damage. Many schools across Los Angeles were closed because of poor air quality and classes were cancelled at 265 schools Thursday. Back in the beachside city of Ventura, the fire killed more than two dozen horses at a stable and had destroyed at least 150 structures, a number that was expected to get far bigger as firefighters are able to assess losses. Air tankers that had been grounded much of the week because of high winds flew on Wednesday, dropping flame retardant. Firefighters rushed to attack the fires before winds picked up again. "We're basically in an urban firefight in Ventura, where if you can keep that house from burning, you might be able to slow the fire down," said Tim Chavez, a fire behaviour specialist at the blaze. "But that's about it." ___ Dalton reported from Los Angeles. Associated Press Writers Brian Melley, Robert Jablon, Michael Balsamo, John Antczak, Jae Hong and Reed Saxon in Los Angeles contributed to this report. ___ For complete coverage of the California wildfires, click here: https://apnews.com/tag/Wildfires Editors' Picks

thread.title_full: Meghan Markle Returns To L.A. Before Heading To Vacation With Prince Harry

posts.author: Camille Heimbrod
posts.title: Meghan Markle Returns To L.A. Before Heading To Vacation With Prince Harry
posts.text:
Meghan Markle is back in Los Angeles to spend time with her mom, Doria Radlan.
The “Suits” actress returned to her hometown just 10 days after she and Prince Harry announced that they are engaged. According to E! News , Markle will be in Los Angeles for the next few days, and she will return to London to reunite with her fiancé for the holidays.
After celebrating Christmas together, and possibly spending the holidays with Prince Harry’s entire family, Markle and the prince will be heading out for a short vacation. “They’re looking forward to some sun,” a source said.
While Markle is in the country and Prince Harry is in London, the two stay connected through texting. A source close to the actress revealed that the couple is both heavy texters.
The source also shared that Prince Harry loves using emojis in his conversations with his fiancée. They also FaceTime each other all the time to stay connected despite the distance.
Meanwhile, Markle and Prince Harry will be tying the knot in May 2018 at St. George’s Chapel at Windsor Castle. Details about their wedding are still being kept under wraps, but there are reports suggesting that Prince Harry and his family will be paying for everything.
According to E! News, Prince Harry has also asked Prince William to be his best man. Traditionally, royals don’t have a best man at their wedding. Instead, they have “supporters.” Prince Charles, for instance, asked his brothers to be his supporters when he married Princess Diana in 1981.
However, Prince William broke royal tradition in 2011 when he asked Prince Harry to be his best man at his wedding. Kate Middleton’s sister, Pippa Middleton, served as her main of honor.
Middleton will not have a part in Markle and Prince Harry’s upcoming nuptials because she would have just given birth to their third child then. But Prince William and Middleton’s kids, Prince George, and Princess Charlotte, will have roles in their uncle’s wedding.
The daughter of Markle’s best friend, Jessica Mulroney, will also have a part in her and Prince Harry’s wedding. As of late, Markle has not chosen her maid of honor.

Meghan Markle is in Los Angeles, but she will soon return to London before heading out for a short vacation with Prince Harry. Pictured: Markle attends the Terrance Higgins Trust World AIDS Day charity fair at Nottingham Contemporary on Dec. 1, 2017 in Nottingham, England. Photo: Getty Images/Chris Jackson

thread.section_title: Amazon.ca Vacuums & Floor Care
thread.title: Customer reviews: iRobot Braava 380T Floor Mopping Robot, Black
thread.title_full: Amazon.ca:Customer reviews: iRobot Braava 380T Floor Mopping Robot, Black

posts.author: Dan L
posts.text:
Bought this guy mainly for mopping purpose as there are not many mopping robots out there, sweeping mode seems alright but mopping is more of its main duty. the biggest pain about this guy is limited with its range, you need to move the navigation cube around if you have a large house. Our main floor is 2000sq ft (80% hardwood, 20% tiles), and I have to move the navigation cube 4-5 times in order to get to the most areas.
The mopping pad holder, this holder is designed to hold wet mop, and yet it uses velcro to hold these mopping pads, after 1 month of usage, the velcro is already peeling off the holder, small fix if you just use super glues to hold it back in place. keep this in mind and don't be surprised if it comes off one day.
The robot itself can't go back to charge itself, once its job is done, he it just sit there and wait you to move him back to charge, and if his mop holder is still wet, you might want to avoid letting it sit there too long if you don't want your hardwood floor stay wet for a long time.
Conclusion, it mops alright but definitely cant replace a human's job yet. This guy is best to be used after a vacuum robots, and no I'm not satisfied with the iRobot Roomba 980 either. iRobot seriously need to re-think their navigation maps on these machine, too dumb for the 21st century. stars: 3

thread.section_title: International Business Times
thread.title: Kevin Spacey Sexual Assault: Actor Accuses Him Of Delaying ‘The Usual Suspects’
thread.title_full: Kevin Spacey Sexual Assault: Actor Accuses Him Of Delaying ‘The Usual Suspects’

posts.author: Sally Japco
posts.title: Kevin Spacey Sexual Assault: Actor Accuses Him Of Delaying ‘The Usual Suspects’
posts.text:
The sexual assault allegations against “House of Cards” star Kevin Spacey are far from over. This time around, his co-star from the 1995 thriller “The Usual Suspects” has come forward and accused him of delaying the film because of his inappropriate behavior on set.
Gabriel Byrne said that filming for “The Usual Suspects” stopped for a while, but they had no clue what caused the delay. He told The Times that the people on set knew about Spacey’s tendency to indulge in inappropriate behavior, but they had no idea just how bad it was.
“I did not know honestly then the extent of his violence,” said Byrne. “I mean, he was kind of a joke in that people would say, ‘That’s Kevin,’ but nobody really understood the depth of his predations. It was only years later that we began to understand that [filming] was closed down for a particular reason and that was because of inappropriate sexual behavior by Spacey.”
He then compared Spacey to Hollywood mogul Harvey Weinstein, who was also swamped with sexual harassment and rape accusations. Byrne said the two of them shared “that element of absolute abuse of power.”
“The Usual Suspects” was even tackled in the December 3 episode of “Family Guy” called “Crimes and Meg’s Demeanor,” according to Indie Wire . The cartoon’s creator, Seth MacFarlane, and his writing team took a jab at Spacey’s gay revelation in light of the sexual harassment allegations made against him.
Peter, Lois and Meg were all watching the end of “The Usual Suspects,” and the big twist of the movie was that Spacey’s character was actually Keyser Söze the whole time. But instead of being shocked by the revelation, Peter was more concerned about Spacey’s personal drama. “Wait, he was gay the whole time?” he said.
It was “Star Trek” star Anthony Rapp who first accused Spacey of sexual misconduct dating back to 1986. Rapp, who was 14 then while Spacey was 26, claimed that Spacey harassed him at a party when he was carried “up like a groom picks up the bride over the threshold.”
After the accusation, Spacey offered an apology and came out as a gay man. “I have loved and had romantic relationships with men throughout my life, and I choose now to live as a gay man. I want to deal with this honestly and openly and that starts with examining my own behavior,” he said in a statement . 
Kevin Spacey’s behaviour on the set of “The Usual Suspects” caused the film’s delay. In this photo, the actor attended the 71st Tony Awards on June 11, 2017. Photo: Reuters/Eduardo Munoz Alvarez

thread.section_title: Tenants call out Chiu on key rent-control measure – Grassroots Actions
thread.title: Tenants call out Chiu on key rent-control measure
thread.title_full: Tenants call out Chiu on key rent-control measure

posts.author: zRants
posts.title: Tenants call out Chiu on key rent-control measure
posts.text:
By Tim Redmond : 48hills – excerpt
They demand that cautious Assemblymember take a more active role in helping stop evictions A group of San Francisco tenants and advocates delivered an eviction warning to Assemblymember David Chiu today, urging that he help push a repeal of the notorious Costa-Hawkins bill through the Legislature.
Chiu is the chair of the Assembly Housing Committee, the first stop on the path toward bringing the repeal bill to the floor.
The author of the bill is Assemblymember Richard Bloom of Santa Monica. Chiu is listed as a co-author, but tenant advocates say he has not made the measure a priority…
Here are the members of the committee . Five are Democrats; two are Republicans. The current leadership of the Assembly and the Democratic Party have no made tenant issues a priority, and apparently don’t want to put pressure on anyone to vote to help renters…
True said Chiu wants to meet with the tenants, and that’s fine. But what we have here is a very different philosophy. Chiu has endorsed Sonja Trauss , the build-at-all-costs candidate who no tenant organization would ever support, in District 6. He doesn’t look to the Tenants Union and the Housing Rights Committee for direction; he looks to what’s good for his relations with the rest of the Assembly Democrats, who are often real-estate shills… (more) 
RELATED: Little-known Yimby-developer bills will have big impact on local planning

thread.title: Texas Cheerleader Goes Viral For This Shocking Move
thread.title_full: Texas Cheerleader Goes Viral For This Shocking Move

posts.author: Alexyz Liggins
posts.title: Texas Cheerleader Goes Viral For This Shocking Move
posts.text:
Comment Who would have thought that making an invisible box and stepping over it would go viral? In the year of viral easy videos, on is to wonder, “well dang what can I do to get my video to go viral?” 
Well, this Texas teen may not have planned on going viral but she actually did. 
A video surfaced of Ariel Olivar doing an incredible trick that has the entire world, well social media world buzzing. 
— ariel (@arielo1220) December 2, 2017 
The video features Olivar patting on air, then stepping on what looked to be an invisible box and landing on the other side. 
Crazy right, we thought so too when we saw the video. Imidetly questions began to rise about how exactly she did that trick. 
The video which was posted to twitter already has been retweeted over 120,000 times and liked over 248,000 times in a matter of days. “When I posted it to my Snap story and then later on at night to Twitter … it exploded and went everywhere,” she said in an interview. She continued, “I was up all night because the notifications would not stop coming and it’s unbelievable how a six-second video got to this where we are now.” Since the video has gone viral, Olicar has received a lot of notification from people saying that it is fake. However today on GMA she proves that this stunt is “totally, 100 percent real.” Take a look at the picture below of her doing it and the video up top!

posts.author: Michael Lloyd
posts.text: Sandy Gemmill's letter clears away the undergrowth of misunderstanding and misinformation. What he proposes is the only solution, if we must have Brexit. Of course it leaves us paying for something we can't influence, so no Brexit would be better still.

thread.section_title: Herald Scotland

thread.title_full: Letters: All the signs point to the EU walking away in frustration over Brexit | HeraldScotland

thread.section_title: Herald Scotland
thread.title: Letters: All the signs point to the EU walking away in frustration over Brexit
thread.title_full: Letters: All the signs point to the EU walking away in frustration over Brexit | HeraldScotland

posts.author: heraldscotland.com
posts.title: Letters: All the signs point to the EU walking away in frustration over Brexit
posts.text:
THERESA May is in trouble (“Davidson intervention forced May’s hand over Ireland deal”, 6). Late on Tuesday evening, there was no indication that the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) was hurrying to meet the Prime Minister.
David Davis assured the DUP that Northern Ireland would not be “left behind” in the single market and that “regulatory alignment” would apply across the UK post Brexit . This would also alleviate a hard border between Ireland and Northern Ireland.
But will it? What will be aligned? It does not automatically mean remaining in the single market and customs union, does it? And will the four freedoms apply?
How will those aspects outwith the regulatory alignment be dealt with at the border between the UK and the EU and across the Irish “divide”? And if the regulatory alignment is minimal in extent and other trade deals outwith in the “wider world” come into being, there will surely be “hard” border checks of some description. And where the UK “diverges” from the EU, how is that to be regulated at the “borders”? Messy.
Regulatory alignment does not encompass everything and the EU said no cherry picking is to be allowed especially for passporting financial services. Or was Mr Davis making it up as he was placating his MPs? So a degree of “hardness” is inevitable. Labour and the Tories and the DUP are firm on leaving the single market and customs union.
Although Labour is beginning to soften, yet nothing official or definitive has come from Jeremy Corbyn , who seems to have gone silent. That red line cannot be got round other than with full compliance in line with the Norwegian model. Regulatory alignment is a smokescreen. The devil is in the detail. One can see the EU walking away in frustration and leaving Westminster to World Trade Organisation mayhem.
John Edgar,
4 Merrygreen Place,
Stewarton.
IT is time for those negotiating Brexit to sit down around the table and decide what requirements are essential for the UK in the post-Brexit world. If these conditions are acceptable to the EU then these prerequisites will determine what subsidiary conditions must apply.
It appears that the first requirement is that the UK should leave the EU (“Brexit means Brexit”) while the second is that there should be no hard border in Ireland and that the same conditions should apply in Northern Ireland as in the rest of the UK.
Consequently, we have no option but to agree that the UK should leave the EU and remain in the single market and customs union.
At present, we have only had a referendum which has determined that we leave the EU. If the consequences of the need to maintain an open Irish border are unacceptable then there has to be another referendum.
Since Northern Ireland does not have a land border with the rest of the UK, the electorate in the province could, at the same time, be asked if they wish to remain within the single market and customs union if the rest of the UK decides not to do so.
Sandy Gemmill,
40 Warriston Gardens,
Edinburgh .
IT is time to stop this Brexit shambles as Article 50 can still be revoked.
All it needs is a Labour leadership that has, instead, been whipping its MPs to support a hard Brexit, against a customs union and single market.
Unlike Ruth Davidson , Nicola Sturgeon has been the only leader in the UK with a consistent and coherent Brexit plan as outlined in Scotland ’s Place in Europe, with minimal damage to the UK and Scottish economies along the lines of the Norway position.
Ms Davidson is putting DUP interests ahead of Scotland’s vote to remain and specifically opposes a deal that protects Scotland’s businesses and economy.
On Monday, all of the Scottish Tories voted in the House of Commons to allow Westminster’s power-grab over 100 devolved policy.
These include powers over farming support, fisheries, fracking , genetically modified crops, railway franchising, cooperation between Scotland’s justice system and EU counterparts and environmental regulations.
Not one opposition amendment was accepted but it is not too late for the UK Government to make the necessary amendments to the EU (Withdrawal) Bill to respect the devolution settlement.
Scotland’s share of the UK’s Brexit bill will remove £4.25 billion from our budget over 10 years, which is much greater than the £600 million to £1.5bn over a decade that the No campaign told us would be the “unaffordable” independence transition
costs.
With support for independence standing at 47 per cent, Theresa\ May will want to avoid another Scottish referendum but she needs to come up with a bespoke customs union and single market deal for Scotland on similar lines to the one she has been striving to secure for Ireland.
Mary Thomas,
Watson Crescent,
Edinburgh.
I BELIEVE that Ed Archer (Letters, December 4) is being extremely optimistic if he believes that useful reform of the EU could occur should the UK decided to ditch Brexit and work for change from within.
Margaret Thatcher negotiated a rebate for the UK in the 1980s. Tony Blair sacrificed a significant proportion of this in anticipation of improvements in the Common Agricultural Policy. I think we’re still waiting.
In the run up to the referendum campaign, then prime minister David Cameron and his government ministers made several trips to various European cities to meet European national political leaders and EU functionaries, all of whom, we were assured, shared that government’s views of the need for structural and functional reform of the EU.
Only they didn’t, and eventually all Mr Cameron had to show were a few trivial concessions that were related to peripheral issues.
Even these were grudgingly offered and could be rescinded at the whim of the relevant EU governing bodies.
There are a number of Balkan nations in negotiations to join the EU in the not too distant future.
They will all be supplicants for cash, and I fear that our chances of seeking reform in the future will be even less than they are now.
Christopher W Ide,
25 Riverside Road,
Waterfoot,
East Renfrewshire.

thread.title: 'Southern Charms'' Shep Rose Shares Love Advice From Craig Conover, Cameran Eubanks
thread.title_full: 'Southern Charms'' Shep Rose Shares Love Advice From Craig Conover, Cameran Eubanks

posts.author: Catherine Armecin
posts.title: 'Southern Charms'' Shep Rose Shares Love Advice From Craig Conover, Cameran Eubanks
posts.text:
Shepard "Shep" Rose is ready to settle down, but he is still single and is in search of his girl.
The "Southern Charm" star aims to get married and have two children by 40. Rose is now 37 and is still searching for the one. His friends and co-stars Craig Conover and Cameran Eubanks opted to offer love advice for his successful search.
"You know, going into it, no, [I didn't get any advice], but once I met the girls, there was a lot of advice being bestowed upon me," Rose told The Daily Dish . "And, interestingly enough, Craig was pretty insightful, which makes sense because he's basically like a teenage girl. He was like perfect for this situation. He was. He had all these theories and I was like, 'Wow, that's a good theory Craig.'"
While Conover was able to convince Rose with his love theories, the latter felt that Eubanks was not as convincing as they count how many times each of them made a wrong choice. "Cam appears to have it all figured out, doesn't she? But Cam is not right all the time," Rose said. "So I want to get that out. She and I are great friends, but I've convinced her she's been wrong before. But usually, she convinces me that I'm wrong more than I convince her that she's wrong."
Rose and Eubanks are BFF, so their bickering does not really matter. In fact, Rose considered Eubanks his spirit guide while adding that he could sit, talk and giggle with Eubanks for hours, days or weeks.
The "RelationShep" star who has been active in finding the girl of his dreams is ready to leave his "ladies man" reputation when he finds the one. Rose admitted he understood why he gained the title but felt that it was "exasperated."
"I never aspired to be like Warren Beatty or anything. I don't have a silver tongue, I'm not trying to make promises I can't meet," Rose said (via People ). "I'm always looking for someone who's unbelievable to blow my hair back, and I will happily forsake others if and when I find her."
Follow Rose's adventures in finding the girl of his dreams in his new series "RelationShep" on Bravo, which premieres on Monday. 

Shepard Rose talked about the relationship advise he received from pals Craig Connover and Cameran Eubanks. Photo: Bravo

thread.section_title: Pregnancy | Mumsnet Discussion
thread.title: Could be pregnant with 10 week old baby
thread.title_full: Could be pregnant with 10 week old baby | Mumsnet Discussion

posts.author: crisscrosscranky
posts.text:
Firstly to those saying the OP doesn't need advice or a virtual cuddle because she's been trying... my husband and I were TTC number 2 for three years and when I found out I was pregnant I was petrified and thought "oh god, everything is going to change!"- it was a few days before I thought "Yay!"
OP, I agree you need to do a test- if the symptoms are pregnancy the test will show and if it's negative it's probably just sign of body adjusting. I found that I'd forgotten a lot of AF symptoms after nearly a year off and they are similar to early pregnancy symptoms (which for most people with a ten week old is rather alarming )

posts.title: Advent Calendar Day 7 – Sarah's Homestead
posts.text:
December 7, 2017 Advent Calendar Day 7 Welcome to my 2017 advent calendar! Each day, I’ll have something new and special here for you. Some of the treats might be good for one day only–like a free book on Amazon!–and others will be more mundane blog entries like Christmas recipes. I’d recommend coming back each day so you don’t miss out on anything. Now what’s behind door number seven…? 70+ Best Christmas Cookie Recipes 
In my family, we have a few classic holiday traditions that we come back to year after year–and I plan to share one or two of them during my advent calendar–but I also love trying new things. Especially when it comes to cookie swaps or giving baked goods as gifts to loved ones! 
That’s what made this list of over seventy cookie recipes such fun. There’s so much to choose from! I still haven’t made it all the way through the list, but I’m going to be making those peppermint kiss thumbprint cookies today. What’s your favorite Christmas cookie? 
Come back tomorrow for the next reveal in the advent calendar!

thread.section_title: Games and Technology — Penny Arcade
thread.title: Star Citizen | Squadron 42 | Infinite cities with nothing in them (est. release 2067) 11
thread.title_full: Star Citizen | Squadron 42 | Infinite cities with nothing in them (est. release 2067) - Page 11 — Penny Arcade

posts.author: Kashaar
posts.text:
I apologize for my earlier brevity, was on the train on my way to work after 3h of interrupted sleep on my phone, and forgot my manners and eloquence at home. Didn't mean to be snippy, so let me make up for it by explaining why I just lolled and said no.
As Campy said, I do indeed work in the industry myself (at a mid-sized studio owned by a large publisher), and while that gives me an idea of the amount of time and manpower required to create modern games, it doesn't give me magical insight into the cost and budgeting of studios, so let's just get that out of the way first. The allotted budgets and actual costs for games (we'll get to the difference in a bit) are generally kept well enough under wraps, because they are important trade secrets. You don't want your competitors to know how deep your pockets are, and how much you're spending on a game aimed to be a competitor to one of theirs, because it tells them how much you estimate the release will earn you, which lets them make educated guesses about what's going on behind your closed doors, and so on and so forth.
With that in mind, any and all budget information about released games we hear about are to be regarded as hearsay at best, PR at worst.
The 10k per month per developer rule gives you a much better ballpark for the actual cost of games. So let's apply that to something like CoD: WW2: 225 people at Sledgehammer games according to Wikipedia, times 36 months development cycle, gives us a ballpark development budget of $81mil. This does not yet factor in the budget required for performance capture sessions with actors, art outsourcing, or the marketing budget, which is going to be at least as high as the development budget for high profile titles like this. You're easily looking at a budget of $200+mil, and that's for a well-managed title in an established production pipeline (all of which brings costs down). Look instead at something like GTA V with its alleged 1000 developers (a doubtful number, and probably not all concurrent) and 5 year development cycle and that's quite a different ballpark ($600mil) - but then again it also made $1bil in the first few days of sales alone, so I'd say it was probably worth it.
It's also important to realize that all the crowdfunded money that is used on Star Citizen goes into both marketing and development. Anything we see on their website - every new ship concept or model, every single video (they produced a whole fricking reality tv casting show), is created in equal parts for the sake of the game and for the sake of raising more money. It's kind of ironic, really: we're paying a developer to market to us the thing that we're paying for. I mean really, their PR is highly laudable: it's without exception very well written, and doled out at a far higher frequency than other developers' paltry dev blogs. But it has to be:
According to LinkedIn, there are 271 people listing Cloud Imperium Games as their employer. Some of those are probably ex-employees, and some other employees probably don't use LinkedIn, and there are probably a bunch of fakes in there as well. So if we assume:
- a head count of 250 people for a nice round number, and
- that they created the initial prototype that was shown in the Kickstarter campaign with a small but sweet team of 10 people, and
- that their growth has been linear (in the absence of more precise data),
then that lets us use the midpoint average of 130 people over the time period as a ballpark figure to estimate development cost (not budget). The Kickstarter concluded in November 2012 (Jesus fuck, that long ago?), which puts the development cost from Kickstarter to present at $78mil. (Yay napkin math!) This, again, does not figure in marketing budget, but as I said earlier: in the type of development Star Citizen practices, you can't separate the two as neatly. Importantly, it also doesn't include external costs for all the studios they outsource to. So, with all that, I'd be very surprised if they have much of a financial buffer - they've got to be relying on the money that keeps coming in to keep development going. If interest were to wane significantly, and people would stop buying ships or refunding en masse, they could very quickly run out of cash. So they HAVE to keep pushing and marketing this to us, which in turn informs development priorities. This whole thing has got to be a project management and producing nightmare.
In a traditional developer-publisher relationship, a game is scoped out by the developer, and then pitched to the publisher with a set budget in mind. The publisher then checks whether they think the product will earn them a profit based on the projected costs and a ton of external factors and experience, and then greenlights the project. Often development is based around milestones, which the developer has to complete in order to unlock the next chunk of funding - this is done so that the publisher can be sure that the developer will manage to hit the target, and stop funding or adjust projections if it looks like the project is going off the rails. The publisher is footing much of the bill, so this is a necessary and important part of traditional development.
Star Citizen doesn't have any of those built-in touchpoints or checks and balances, they only have us - who, as a collective group, know very little about the behind-the-scenes realities of production. I can only imagine what their budgeting method looks like, but I wouldn't be surprised if the most efficient way for them to go about it is not dissimilar from common F2P business and budgeting models. That means relying on KPIs and metrics to project and constantly adjust confidence in your projected budgets... but that side of the business doesn't have a lot of appeal to me. But the point is: it's a mistake to confuse the big bold number in the fundraising ticker with the actual scheduled budget, or with the money they've spent on development (or will have spent at the end).
In closing, so you don't the wrong idea, I'd like to stress: most of this is just educated guesswork and speculation. I have no insight into what goes on behind the scenes of Star Citizen's development, I only have some insights into established practices of traditional development, and can make slightly more educated guesses based on those. As a future player who bought in with a lot more money than I would have spent on this in retail, I'm bitter that my favorite ship seems to have landed on the lowest rung of the priority ladder; as a sci-fi fan, I love the steady stream of gorgeous spaceship porn they pump out, and can't wait for more, even knowing the final product will likely be far below my expectations; but as a developer, I am mostly fascinated and terrified by its production, and very much looking forward to the inevitable postmortem 5 years after its eventual release or cancellation.
